text: Great summary of Scott. As it happens, I mentioned Scott here a few days ago: <https://futureofcoding.slack.com/archives/CC2JRGVLK/p1545185105115300?thread_ts=1545141138.109900&cid=CC2JRGVLK>

attachments.fallback:
[December 18th, 2018 6:05 PM] ak: I just read your link and skimmed the comment and post you linked to. My links are more narrow and focused on just software, so I'm not sure how useful they are to you.

Signal vs corrective seems like another way to think about James Scott's notion of Legibility from _"Seeing like a State"_.

Your link reminded me of a less software-focused post I wrote years ago: <https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2014/04/09/the-legibility-tradeoff>
attachments.text:
I just read your link and skimmed the comment and post you linked to. My links are more narrow and focused on just software, so I'm not sure how useful they are to you.

Signal vs corrective seems like another way to think about James Scott's notion of Legibility from _"Seeing like a State"_.

Your link reminded me of a less software-focused post I wrote years ago: <https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2014/04/09/the-legibility-tradeoff>
